author: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001
Teoderick Contreras, Splunk
description: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: The following analytic detects the addition of NOPASSWD entries to the /etc/sudoers file on Linux systems. It leverages Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) telemetry to identify command lines containing "NOPASSWD:". This activity is significant because it allows users to execute commands with elevated privileges without requiring a password, which can be exploited by adversaries to maintain persistent, privileged access. If confirmed malicious, this could lead to unauthorized privilege escalation, persistent access, and potential compromise of sensitive data and system integrity.
false_positives: Administrator or network operator can execute this command. Please update the filter macros to remove false positives.
name: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: Linux NOPASSWD Entry In Sudoers File
query:
sequence by process.entity_id
 [process where process.executable : "/usr/bin/sudo" and process.args : "*NOPASSWD:*" and event.category == "process"]
